page.title: 16EDUCATION(Continued)
page.content: 1.Memories of Dair House School-It had 3 forms and 18 rooms.1st years had hot milk and biscuits on cold days.I entered the 1st form at 5 years missing the Transition class.At the back of the school was a redwood tree,there we played toy cars.There were 2 climbing frames,and a football field which was fringed with woods on 2 sides.Since I left a new Assembly hall has been made. 2.Memories of Dropmore School-There were 3 classes.We played in the sand pit,the trees and large blue barrels.We went on nature walks in the Beeches,had a school choir,recorder lessons and for craft we chose from Scottish dancing, pottery and basket making.Lunch was a set meal.There were 75 children in 1978,64 in 1981 and there are only 2 classes.(N.B School is outside the block.)
